Question
========

Caps of Coke bottles vary slightly in diameter. Suppose you take two random samples of 40 and 60 caps, respectively. Do they have the same distribution?

Answerlist
----------

* Yes, they have the same means and standard errors.
* No, the sample of 40 caps has a larger mean and standard error than the sample of 60.
* No, the sample of 60 caps has a larger mean and standard error than the sample of 40.
* No, they have different means and standard errors.
* No, they have the same means but different standard errors.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* Yes, they have the same averages and standard errors...: Incorrect
* No, the sample of 40 caps has a larger mean and standard error than the sample of 60...: Incorrect
* No, the sample of 60 caps has a larger mean and standard error than the sample of 40: Incorrect
* No, they have different means and standard errors...: Incorrect
* No, they have the same means but different standard errors...: Correct
